text: Golden color with a white head. A faint aroma of caramel and some dark fruit. The flavor is malty and a bit sweet with some caramel, biscuit, and mild citrus flavors. The aftertaste is a bit sweet some hard candy in there. Overall this is ok not great.
bah the worst beer in the sampler, very thin and sweet, white sugar flavors. Not much else, malt syrup and water added.

Tap at Bud. Copper-gold color, clear and quite pale for the style, with a fine head. Light to medium malty nose with a touch of caramel and very light hops. Toast malt flavor, touch of caramel again, peaches, a bit roasty with decent bitterness and maybe even a touch of booze. Nice drinking.

Keg at the Kings Arms, 14/11/16.
Golden with a decent off white head.
Nose is toasted bread, citric rinds, grains, fresh cereal notes.
Taste comprises bready malts, mellow citric tang, caramel, toasted grains.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent clean drinking lager.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: It pours a dark golden with a clear off white head. The head does not last that long. It has strong malt aromas that feature a strong toasty smell. There are toasty flavors with floral hops providing balance. It has a dry taste as well. It has a medium-light body with medium carbonation with a slightly bitter finish. Overall, it is a fairly well balanced between the malts and the hops that produces a dry and slightly bitter finish.

Pours a clear golden orange from the bottle with fluffy off-white head that leaves good lace. Aroma of earthy hops, mild sweet malts, and lager yeast. Taste follows, a bit of bitterness. I like more malty caramel viennas but this isn?t bad.
Bottle into a dimpled mug. Pours a pale amber, with a small white head that quickly fades. Not much nose, but a faint aroma of grain. Taste is watery, bland, inoffensive. Lawnmower beer.
Pours a honey from a bottle. Speaking of honey, nose is of honey and maybe a wheat cracker, a little toast. Flavor is more of caramel. Good beer.

Soooooo, what happens when an Amber lager isnt amber? This one wasnt, it was pale. And it wasnt even a good pale lager. Eh, not much flavor at all. Pass on this one. Way too many SN beers and amber lagers out there.

Hmm I've sampled this on two separate occasions and was disappointed both times by this lager from Sierra Nevada. Appearance is a nice tarnished bronze amber with a steady crown of white foam, aroma is an ok caramel and grain with grassy hops, unusually grassy for the style. Likewise the flavor is caramel malt like a Marzen, but with an unpleasant spicy grain accent that pairs poorly with a sharp herbal/grassy hop tang in the finish, simply not that appealing IMHO. Unique but not in a way that I would want to try this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured clear reddish amber in color, nice white head and some moderate lacing. Aroma of caramel, bread and some apple. Taste is sweet, some fruit and quite a bit of grain and yeast; some hops in there too. Easy to drink enjoyable beer.

Bottle. Bready malt with toasted notes. Sweet caramel with some pleasant hop bitterness in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a rock solid lager and I want more of it. I want it in sixers and not the fall pack! Clean, light but not thin or watery. Good bready/toasty malts, lightly hopped at the finish.

Bottle. True gold in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of honeyed malt, wet stones, a bit of caramel, and iron. Flavors are of Vienna malt, mild green hop, crusty white bread, and minerals. Light bodied with a snappy finish. Restrained... almost a touch too simplistic, but still decent.

My kind of beer!! Great lager with tons flavor and great color from an usually lame category 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at wifes work party. Poured amber, small off white head. Aroma was malty, roast malts, bread. Taste was sweet, toasted, caramel.

Bottle from Market Basket
Slightly hazy deep golden color with a small but long lasting bubbly white head. Sweet bready pilsner maltiness with a hint of toast. Light floral hop moderate spicy hop flavor. Pretty nice drinker.

2015 BJCP Category: 7A Vienna Lager
AROMA: Malt-forward nose with mostly pale and amber malt. Slight toasty character. Faint floral hop presence. Clean fermentation character. 9/12APPEARANCE: Dark golden/amber proper hue. Crystal clear with effervescence visible. Average, white, foam; little to no lacing. 2/3FLAVOR: Mostly amber malt with slight honey-on-toast flavor. More malty than sweet. Firm hop bitterness on the finish with medium-low floral/spicy flavor. Malts and hops both linger in the aftertaste. Clean fermentation. 18/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium-ish body and carbonation. Consistently crisp. Goes down smooth. Aftertaste is a bit starchy, but faint. 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: One of the best commercial examples of the style. Itd be perfect with just a few tweaks. 9/10TOTAL SCORE: 42/50NOTE: I am a rank-pending BJCP judge. I am reviewing commercial beer to BJCP specs to hone my judging skills.

Rating #2237 - 2015.12.09 - Draught @CraftBeerYYC. Clear dark brown pour with a foamy tan head, medium retention. Aroma is doughy, hints of pastry, butterscotch, and a mild citrus/fruit sweetness. Medium carbonation, crisp mouthfeel. Taste is a hint of toffee, toasted pumpernickel. Lovely malt-forward amber.
Solid hop balance with a grass body, a bit of vanilla, and a bubbly finish.
12oz. Bottle from fall sampler - nose is cardboard, grass, and toast. Sip adds wild grass and cereal. Lots of flavor and balanced. Cloying finish but not too much.

Pour from a 12oz bottle. Deeper shade of gold with thin fizzy head that instantly vanishes leaving no ring or lacing. Aroma of sweet malt with toasty notes, a little citrus and hay. Taste is light sweet malt up front with some grass and lemon citrus in the finish. Even though the tastes are all very restrained it comes across as somewhat clumsy and unbalanced. Palate is somewhat full bodied but both bottles I sampled were very weakly carbonated. Disappointed.
It is a very tasty beer. Yeast, malt and hops all playing their part, but playing it lightly. Its tasty and well-crafted but Im not sure Ill remember it yknow.
Poured from bottle. Smelling malt, lemon, spice. Looks more gold than amber. I taste dry malt, hay, crisp hops, touch of citrus and vanilla. Refreshing feel. Not bad.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text:
Bottle. Pours a clear golden beer with modest head. Has slight caramel and bread notes with light fresh hops. Light bodied. Average carbonation. This is very refreshing. Smooth and crisp with just enough flavor. Well done! Once in a while it is nice not to have to drink a hop bomb beer. They are getting way overdone. This is just what the doctor ordered. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A decent Vienna. Light aroma of lager yeast and sweet malt. Pour was a nice medium gold with a thin off white film for a head. Taste was typical lager. The caramel maltiness combined with a slightly sweet graininess for a light refreshing beer. Just a slight hint of hops in he finish. Finish was dry and quick. Not a huge fan of the style but this is as good as any. Good carbonation.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12 oz. bottle, part of a mixed 12 pack. Pours a clear copper with a one finger off white head that recedes to a ring. Minimal lace. Biscuit & honey aroma. Semi sweet flavor. More biscuit balanced with light grassy hops. Medium bodied and easy to drink. Nice.

Bottle from LaBodega, crystal clear amber beer, white head. Aroma lager nuttiness, malt, hint of floral honey. Taste is malt, lager nuttiness, hint of honey. Palate is light, carbonation moderate, finish has a touch of hops.
Golden pour with a thin white head. Nice bready aroma. Malty flavor with bread and biscuit notes and a bitter hop finish.

Slight spicy notes from hops with biscuit overtones. Pours a clear light amber with a dusting of white head. Touch of toast and bread in the flavor, nice crisp hop finish. Light bodied, and a nice summer beer, which makes it a bit strange that its in the Autumn mix pack.

Review: Bottle of Sierra Nevada Vienna Style Lager: ABV: 5.30% 

A Vienna style beer is a light coloured amber lager that has a delicate balance between sweet caramel malts and floral hops

Aroma: Lovely smell, I got toasted biscuit tones, sweet caramel and malts, all of which were absolutely lovely to smell, wow, really liked the aroma, good start.................

Appearance: On pour I got a clear amber looking colour, and a massive head which was very frothy, but it does settle down quick enough to peter out, no real lacing, and ok to look at

Lovely taste, really enjoyed drinking this beer, was dead smooth and easy to drink from start to finish, a type of beer to saviour long into the night, excellent.

Tasted a lot of malt, also got caramel and toffee

Really full of tastes, sweet but not too sweet, and all flavours balanced and drinkable

I liked it a lot, a beer that is clean and very smooth. Definitely will be checking out this beer again. Enjoyable and very easy to drink. Recommended..
Pours an amber body with a thin head. Faint hoppy aroma. Nice taste of malt even if it is a bit watery. Very nice subtle bitterness.
Bottle. Hay, toffee, and roasted barley malt aroma. Hazy golden yellow with small head. Sweet nutty toffee malt and lightly bitter dry hay flavor. Good body. A good Vienna.
(bottle) clear, bright amber colour with a small tan head; smooth palate; aroma of grain, noble hops, toffee; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish
Pours amber with small head. Smells malty, biscuity, sweet bread. Tastes very bready, toasty, light bodied but the maltiness makes it less refreshing. Pretty good.

Bottle:
Clear amber with a thick, off-white head.
Caramel, mild breadheel aroma.
Lightly toasted caramel malt, a bit of nut.
Sweet and simple.
Very satisfying.
bottled from mix pack, amber orange color with some white foam, aroma is bready caramel, flavor is caramel, sweet some balance of hops, nice finish
Tasting at Matts, packaged 07/01/15Amber color, small dissipating head. Very simple malt aroma and flavor, low bitterness; clean; nothing bad with it, just terribly boring.

Bottle from OBriens, Athlone [161215]
Amber, clear, frothy white head, little head retention
Aroma of soft spicy hops, hint of citrus
Taste of caramel malt, soft spicy hops, touch of grain, dull
Palate - Medium carb, medium to light body, bit fizzy. Finish is soft bitter, fairly dry, hint of toasty malt
Overall - Less sweet than Brooklyn Lager. Didnt do a lot for me - found it dull.

Pours a beautiful orange or light bronze, or amber. About one finger tan head. Well carbonated.Aroma is very malty, lightly toasted. A little nutty. A little caramel and toffee. Subtle, yet complex.Taste is very malty. Did I mention it was malty? Sweet, but almost cloying, not quite. Enough hops to keep it from being too sweet. Toasted malts shine here. A little nutty, a little caramel. Reminds me a lot of a marzen, but maybe a tad sweeter.Mouthfeel is light to medium. Dry, super clean finish. Super drinkable. Maybe a tad bitter right at the very end.Overall, this is great. Much better than I expected. This is a winner. Do try this one!!!
Tea, honey, pecan, dried leaves nose. Clear orange, medium head. Honey and pecan, honeycomb cereal finish. Mildly sweet, far from cloying. Light body, easy carbonation. Very enjoyable.
Lager smell with slight sweetness. Mild. Amber color with little carb. Even taste with smoothness on front of tongue.

Pours a clear reddish copper with a frothy tan head. Aroma of sweet caramel malts, light nuttiness and a clean floral lager yeast Aroma in the background. Taste is much of the same with a smooth malty base complimented nicely by a smooth clean and crisp finish. Sierra Nevada is a brewery that brews excellent beers to style!
Tried at Craft Beer Market YEG. Sierra Nevada tap takeover Nov 18. Toasted caramel malt flavour with some caramel and grain flavours. Easy drinking!

So much maltt. Very solid beer, will made. BUT so what? Kudos to then for making such a fine beverage but it gets no points on the above measures. Appearance is a high point. Malt is non offensive. Everything else is non offensive. Really minimal flaws but leaves nothing positive to say. So um, there is my rank.

12 oz bottle, thanks brenn79. Aroma is dough, chalk, caramel. Pours slightly hazy orange with a medium beige soapy head with good retention and a little lace. Taste is sweet, biscuity, spicy, toasty, clean. Body is a little thin, but its not a detriment. Possibly the best example of this style Ive ever had.
Sweet caramel malt aroma. Deep brownish amber with a modest off-white head. Malty caramel taste with medium bodied feel. Clean refreshing finish. Quality brew.

12 oz bottle. Bottled on 8/10/15. From a trade with IslandHaole. Thanks Dan!
Slightly cloudy amber color with a small white head. 
Caramel, fudge, bready malt and mild hoppy dryness in the aroma. 
The flavor is dry hops, mild bitterness, bready malt and some dark sugary sweetness. Decent.

Bottle from Fall pack. Clear orange-amber pour with fine-bubbled white head, poured into a Sierra Nevada pint glass. Minimal lacing. Gently toasted grain accompanied by moderate honeyed sweetness. Short lightly bitter clean finish. Overall: First bottle I had I found really disappointing. Tonight, though, this is doing the trick. Not a style Im ever likely to love, but right now its hitting the spot.
Copper/gold pour with large foamy white head. Aroma is light sweet malt and floral hops. Flavor is dry malt and a touch of bitter. Medium body with good carbonation. solid beer

Aroma is malty, caramel, rustic, yeasty, pretzelly. Actually, I wish I had some pretzels on hand to drink with this, theyd probably pair well. The taste is malt-centric, but not overwhelming, somewhat comparable to the all-malt Michelob with perhaps a slightly better profile and a little more hops (Or a much better more malty and hoppy Yuengling). Its bready like a soft pretzel or caibatta bread.  The hops are definitely there and easily distinguishable as being present, but are muted relative to Sam Adams Boston Lager, which I guessing this beer is Sierra Nevadas answer to. Ill take a Boston Lager, personally, all else being equal, but this is a pretty solid basic beer.
Amber with an off white head. Toast. Sweet caramel. Earth. Semi dry. Minimal bitterness. Tips sweet but not unbalanced. Good drinkability. Enjoyable but not special.

Pours orange clear and bubbly with an off white head that fades quickly to a bubbled coating and then nada. Aroma is somewhat sweet and bready malts. Quite malty taste with a pleasant bready sweetness and a mild noble hop finish that has a touch of bitterness. Highly drinkable.

Nothing earth-shattering, but smooth and rich and drinkable. Pours bright orange, no real head to speak of, medium carbonation. The aroma is butter and mild vanilla, the flavor is creamy, mildly sweet, and clean. Sierra Nevada doesnt make bad beer, but this is among their least.

12 oz. bottle, pours a hazy amber orange with a small off-white head. Aroma brings out herbal notes, some grassy notes and toasted bready malt. Flavour brings out bready malts and herbal notes. Pretty bland, but clean and drinkable. Its okay, but very meh.
Bottle - Caramel and some green apple. Clear copper with a small beige head. Very light twig and nice sweetness. Not bad.

This is a pretty decent take on an amber lager. It is maybe a hair too sweet but not a disaster or anything. Its a little cloudy w/ a foamy white head and lace in rings. There is a slightly piny hop note but its mostly raisin-like malt. This is a full bodied brew and slightly sticky; I kind of wish it were a bit lighter. It finishes w/ a touch of bitterness and some grainy malt character. Id say this is serviceable but not a home run.

Bottle @ BBQ. Amber in color with white foam. As expected, a good bready malt character and some toasty malts as well. Light floral hop note, some baked apple ester, and a little bit of brown sugar. Kind of grainy for my tastes, but its not bad. Kind of bitter on the finish...okay.
Pours dark amber with an off white head. Aroma is bready caramel. Flavor is sweet, bready, very drinkable.

A interesting mix of hay and cookie dough with hints of caramel and floral hops. A clear copper color with an off-white head. Sweet but not cloying, a touch of honey but enough hop bitterness to balance it. Not bad.
Bottle. Pours amber, clear, average head. Aroma of malts,some yeast, caramel, spices, corn. Taste of bread, caramel, some spices, corn, some alcohol.
Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI, USA. Amber gold, caramel bread and some bright peppery hops. Sweet, more caramel and cereal grain, medium butterscotch finish.
12 ounce bottle. Pours a clear copper with a white head of foam. The aroma has musty, earthy hop qualities and a mild sweetness. Medium body and medium carbonation. Not that bad.

12oz bottle, from my local kroger, split with jstax. Bottled 7/01/15. Clear amber red color. Thin off-white head. Loose bits of lace. Up front, I get corn, vegetable, DMS. Some toasty malt, bit of caramel, and bigger spicier pepperiness. moderate sweet, light bitter taste. Medium body. Kind of crisp, mild soft lighter to moderate carbonation, mild slick finish. I have a lot of respect for sierra nevada, and really high hopes for this one, but it was pretty sweet, plain and disappointing over all.
Delicious and refreshing brew. Flows easily and the pour is a nice honey brown with a thin white head.

This bottle comes courtesy of Prufrock, who generously made sure that I got to tick the SN autumn pack without actually buying one. And I appreciate it, given that Im less enthused with the first two Ive tried. Light orange pour, good-sized off white head. Aroma of warm whole wheat bread and a bit of nut, somewhat sweet malty flavor with hints of hop snap. Nice mouthfeel for the style, but Im not just feeling it here. I like my session lagers lighter.
Bottle packaged 07/01/15. Pours clear orange with a white head. Very light bodied. Bready and malty all the way through. Get a bit of corn husk out of it. Just okay.

2015 bottle. Color of fall leaves with a milf white head. Very light bready aroma with a smidge of caramel. Taste is toasted bread with caramel and a little spice and bitterness at the end. Well balanced and mild. Nice transition beer from the summer to fall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is light bready caramel and crisp. Appearance is brownish orange crystal clear with small off white head. Taste is light caramel bready with a bit of apple. Hint of tangy hops. Palate is medium light and crisp. Overall a nice beer. Well done but lacking some of the big malt flavor found in some of the best Viennas. Still, I would be hard pressed to find a better example of the style at a local store.

A buddy brough the 12 pack over and ai had ine of these. Pours copper, translucent, billowing off white head that fades rather quickly. Nise bready nose, taste is bread and toast forward, light flower hops. Taste is slightly sweet. Light to medium body with light carbonation.

Bottle in pint glass. From Signal Variety Plaistow NH. Aroma is strong bread and caramel malts, light hay, hint of chocolate. Appearance is gorgeous, clear, golden amber with light sparkle and finger-width off-white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Taste is rich sweetness, caramel with a pleasant mild alcohol flavor. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with thin texture, average carbonation and slightly bitter, dry (like removed moisture from my top teeth feeling) finish. Overall, this beer is very true to the style and to the brewers description (a seeming rarity). Appearance is the big winner but with a nice aroma and taste.
Bottle. Pours an amber color with small tan head. Aroma is mostly caramel malt. Mostly sweet flavor with just a little bit of bitter hoppiness. Medium bodied with a mostly smooth finish. Pretty good.
Clean and crisp as advertised. Good malt bite to it, with a hint of Carmel and bread. Not bad.
Bottle. Biscuity malt, slight earthy and leafy hops in the aroma. Flavor has some slight malty bread sweetness, clean, leafy hops. Lighter slick body. Solid.
Pours dark amber with a small off-white head. Some fruit on the nose, caramel malts. Medium, smooth body, some caramel malts, ripe fruit. Easily drinkable.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. Pours with a brilliant clarity. Bready sweet maltiness aroma with subtle fruitiness. The flavor is bready, there is a hop presence that is noticeable, but not overwhelming.

For a Vienna style lager its not half bad, but certainly nothing to go out of your way for... Aroma is some faint toasty malt and earthy hops. Taste is toasted malt and an unyielding sweetness. Finish is crisp and light. Certainly refreshing after a hot summer day and with more malt forwardness than most macro lagers. Nice job...
Deep amber orange, almost copper. Nose of toasted malt, caramel, and fruit. Flavor is tangy toasted malt and light fruit. Gentle hops. Mineral finish.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a very clear light amber color with a small off white head. The aroma has lots of light toast, nuts and subtle fruit notes. The flavor is pleasant with more of the same balanced bread, toast, earthy hops and light notes of dark berry fruit. More bread, toast and light earthy bitterness in the finish. Very drinkable, and a good representation of the style, albeit a little strong with the bitterness.
bottle. Poured clear dark amber with a creamy off-white head. Grainy aroma a touch spicy. Medium body, crisp carbonation with a creamy mouthfeel. Caramel malt flavour, sweet with some peppery hops.
Nice head amber appearance. Bready malty sweet as it warms. Has the sierra Nevada hop bite to it. Nice body similar to a Sam Adams. Lots of carbonation. A bit bland by the end but well made
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
At a tasting, thanks, smallish head, hazy deep orange color, aroma of caramel, brown sugar ,some fruits and some honey, light malty flavor, light to medium bitterness. Disapointing.

Bottle shared with rayaron at a tasting. Clear orange with a white head. 
Aroma of caramel, grainy malts and light floral notes. Taste of sweetish malts, caramel, honey, light fruity notes, low bitterness. Light-medium bodied.

Bottle sample at a tasting at zvsns place. A bit hazy orange-copper with small off-white head. Light aroma of honey, some maltiness and fruits (mostly pear). Quite malty flavor, notes of caramel, fruity, some herbs, light sweetness and sourness. Light carbonation, medium-bodied.

Poured clear copper with a 2 inch foamy beige head. There was a good amount of carbonation bubbles rising up in the beer. The aroma was mild with some caramel malt, bread and light pine. The beer had a slightly thicker texture and a light malt sweetness. A touch of some fruit came along in the middle before the mild dry finish with a little hop bite

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place.Thanks DSG. Pours yellow to orange with a nice head, aroma of grain, malt, fruits and caramel, flavor is bitter with orange, caramel, malt, medium bodied, easy to drink.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 Bottle at home. Pretty  decent -for a lager. Not so much for SN.   Pours a beautiful copper color with a generous white head that disippates quickly. Flavours tend towards bready and caramel upfront with the distinct super clean finish of a lager. Somewhat dry at the end. Bit strange floral and grassy notes. Resiny pine in there too. Medium bodied. My guess is too hoppy for the style.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker glass.
Clear light amber color with a medium off white head.
Clean soft malt, faint floral hops, light caramel notes.
Crisp malt, some caramel, low bitterness, faint biscuit flavors.
Light-med body, balanced and pleasant.
Ok vienna. Drinkable but not exceptional. Reddish colour. Somewhat fair. Medium mouthfeel.

Bottle poured a deep golden hue w/ large off-white head diminishing to a lasting cap. Big sweet citrus and malt aromas. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish. Tastes are straw, light toast, and grass. Medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel, lively carbonation and a dry clean finish.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Clear deep golden-copper with a white head. Aroma of malt, bread, a bit of caramel and a light spicy hops hint. Sweetish flavor with caramel, bread and a drier finish, slightly bitterish. Light to medium-bodied.

Exactly what I would expect from a Sierra Nevada Vienna. .. Tawny, squat bottle, nice hopping, malty. Thanks to PorterPounder, enjoyed whilst the Noles snatched the Canes presumed victory. 60 minutes of football, MyMammy.

Tallahassee, Fl - Market Square Liquors - part of a Fall Mixer - 12 oz bottle. Dark orange pour, light off-white head. Neutral aroma, some brown sugar perks it up a bit, Flavor has some light brown sugar, a bit of light vegetable ripeness, a hint of cotton candy in the finish. Smooth mouthfeel. Pretty solid.

12oz bottle from dmac. Thanks bro! Pours a clear golden orange color with a finger of foamy white head. Aroma of old oranges, caramel malt, and toasted grain. Taste of old citrus, grass, toasted grain, and lager yeast.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2014 12 oz bottle, poured into a nonic pint at approximately 45 degrees F.

A: Poured the color of clean synthetic motor oil, and when pooled into the glass, took on the color of the good, home-raised honey a friend of mine gets from his hives in northern Kentucky. Minimal head formed, and died quickly into a patchy cap and thick ring. Bubbles stream from the bottom of the glass like they’re white girls heading for a Starbucks that just announced Pumpkin Spice Lattes at 50% off.

S: Lightly cinnamon-sugared toast with some caramel-covered toffees on the plate.

T: The flavors open with a lightly roasted caramel toffee toast, as promised by the aroma. This is quickly subsumed by a piney-earthy hop flood with hints of citrus underlying it, which plows into the forefront with all the grace and subtlety of a tanker truck loaded with nitroglycerine slamming into three school buses full of screaming children and a gunpowder factory. That hop barrage takes over completely through the middle, and lingers long after the finish, which is a severe disappointment to this malthead.

M: Very light, but saved from feeling watery by the lively carbonation.

O: I wanted to like this beer. I really did. I love Vienna lagers, to the point that the GLBC Eliot Ness is one of my favorite beers of all time. But when you take a Vienna lager and do your utmost to transform it into an Americanized hop monster version, you lose me completely. I am now sad I picked up two bottles of this in a mix your own six pack.

DATE TASTED: October 12, 2014... GLASSWARE: Weihenstaphaner pokal... OCCASION: Happy sixth birthday, Michael... APPEARANCE: handsome dark amber body; reasonably effervescent; thick, rich three-finger off-white head that settles into articulate Cyrillic arcs and arches ... AROMA: slightly smoky; superior caramel malts; some pepper and peppercorn; some oats and dough late--a burnt toffee ending... PALATE: medium-bodied, slightly creamy; slightly crunchy, with clean finish....TASTE:sweet, tempered toffee malts meld with spirited hops--bright and slightly floral--to develop a symbiotic sip... OVERALL: a crisp, malty/hoppy lager that delivers a sweet toffee reward; a good appreciation of the genre....

Poured from bottle into a tulip glass, light orange appearance with small head. Aroma isnt too strong, but tastes of toasted malt, bread, and a little bit of caramel. Was hoping for a little bit more flavor, but overall a very drinkable beer that I would try again.

~Bready, slightly toasty, caramel malty aroma
~Pours slightly hazy gold color with small white head.
~Malty toasty bready flavor, sweet with balanced hop bitterness.
~medium light bodied, medium CO2, sweet but slightly bitter finish.
~Enjoyable balanced beer. Could drink a couple of these before getting bored though.

Classic Vienna malt aroma. Very "fresh" smelling. Appearance: somewhere between gold and red. Not much lacing. Fairly large, pillowy head. Flavor: toasty bread, slight spiciness, herbal hops lingering. Clean and tasty.

12oz bottle from Xfroads. Poured a clear clean reddish body with a smaller frothy off beige head. Aroma is old malts, slight toffee and caramel, hint of old oranges. Flavor is the same but seems a bit more malty with more breads and toast. Palate is big, stronger carbontation that lasts and is a bit stingy. Meh
Aromas of bread, cereal, and caramel. Pours clear orange with a thin white head. Nice flavor for a lager, fairly bitter and a long finish.

Oct. 28, 2014; 12 oz. bottle from SN Fall sampler. Amber pour; quickly dissipating head; mild lacing. Caramel malt, herbal hops & earthy notes are well balanced. An improved version of Samuel Adams Boston Lager. Nice autumn offering.

12 oz. bottle.
A beautiful beer that well represents the type. Pours a light hue for a Vienna, with a off-white head. Aroma is biscuity and malty with a bit of orange. Taste is grainy and bready with some grassy hops.

12 oz bottle from the Sierra Nevada Fall Pack, packaged over 3 months ago and purchased at Biggie Wine & Liquor and poured into my Funkwerks goblet. Light amber-orange, slightly hazy appearance with a white head and light lacing. Aroma of toasted grains, bready malts, floral notes, light spicy hops and a touch of fruit. Similar flavor, smooth and balanced with light malty sweetness and mild hop bitterness. Light to medium body, crisp and pretty clean with ample carbonation. Easy to drink, a pretty decent Vienna-style lager. Probably a bit bitter when fresh.

bottle. deep golden with one finger head. this is a style ive never really liked, but maybe its because ive never had a good one before now. toasty malt, some caramel and a bit bready. mild hops in the finish. no one element stands out, but they mesh very well.
Brown copper in the glass. Nutty toasty aroma. Clean dry crusty bread flavor. Overall, tasty! Thanks BarZigKin for sharing!
Clear amber with a fair amount of white head. Bready, malt aroma. Flavor is similar, strong malt taste with a little bit of a hoppy finish.
Bottle, as pictured. Drank it out of the bottle so Ill have to defer to the other reviewers on that point. Heavy on the bready yeasty flavor, but not unbalanced. Pretty sweet but easy to drink.
Solid easy drinking amber lager with a good balance between malt and hops, a clean, crisp finish and a decent body. Low on flavor and aroma.

Bottle from Wal-Mart: Poured a burnt amber hue colored liquid and topped with a perfect layer of foam head. Aroma is mild with a fragrant scent of caramel malts while also smelling as if this was an imported German beer. The drink is well balanced and has a notice of spiced hops while also having a sweet background of caramel malts. Reminds me a lot of Karl Strauss vienna style and I mean that in a good way. Finish had notes of astringent medicine flavors.

Pours a crystal clear reddish orange with a white head. Aroma of hay and bread. Taste is malty and complex sweet up front with a bitter dry finish. Good balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 12 oz bottle into schooner glass.

Appearance: pours a 1" off white fluffy head that recedes slowly with some mild lacing. Color is a mostly clear amber with abundant streaming carbonation.

Aroma: balanced aroma of bread dough, pungent hops, and cracker.

Mouthfeel: between light and medium bodied, somewhat oily with a quick dry finish.

Flavor: medium roasted barley and tangy, pungent hops combine nicely with some toasted bread and biscuit notes.

Overall: another winner from Sierra Nevada. Highly drinkable and delicious.
Im gonna vote no on this. Thin and cardboardy. Sierra should stick to more hoppy beers.
Pours a light brownish color. Weak aroma but a nice subtle flavor. Not my favorite but very drinkable.

12 ounce bottle from a mixed Autumn 12 pack. The aroma is sweet with honey characteristics, as well as some floral notes as well. Some graham cracker is also present. Transparent orangey-copper body with a medium, creamy off-yellowish head present. Starts with some lightly sweet, crackery malt flavors. Becomes more floral in the middle, before this finishes with a fairly aggressive, bitterly hopped finish. Earthy hops. More bitter than I would expect.

Amber. Spicy, grassy hops on the nose. Taste- bready malt and spicy hops. Very we'll balanced. Tasty Vienna. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Opaque gold with a small off white head. Aromas of toasted malt, yeast, caramel, and some earthy, herbal notes. Flavor is caramel, toasted malt, yeast, and some grassy/ pine notes on the end. Medium bodied, crisp.

12oz bottle... Pours a polished light orange... nice enough white head... decent lacing.

Nose shows pretty much perfect light toasted malt and no real hops to speak of..

Flavor mirrors the palate with a bit of grassy hoppiness on the finish.. Light/medium body with good bubble makes for a very drinkable brew... Soft and still very drinkable... Perhaps too much carbonation.

I dig this one.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, clear orange-red pour with white head, aroma brought notes of caramel, toffee, bread, some dough, some spicy notes, some nice grassy notes, touch of red fruit. Taste is a mix of grass, spice, yeast, bread, some doughy notes into some toast, slight red fruits, finishing slightly sweet, slightly dry.

Bottle into a glass. Clean, clear copper pour. Thin off-white head.Aroma is a lot of sugar and roasted caramel malt and a bit off putting. Taste is a bit more complex. Definitely some sugary sweetness, but a hint of spicy, bitter hops as well as a solid grainy cereal malt backbone. Bit of a fruity finish. Real easy drinking. Only complaint really is that supper sugary nose. Would like a bit more of the hop character to shine through there.
Very good for style. Sweet but not overbearing. Lacks the metallic component that a lot in this style have. A stronger hop profile is what makes it nice and balanced.
From a bottle at a party. Carmelly and moderately hoppy. Far hoppier than any Vienna Ive had. Thin, watery finish. Way off-style. This is a poor example of a Vienna and a quite mediocre beer.
Bottle. Orange color, white head, hoppy, somewhat malty aroma. Taste is smooth, easy to drink... not really much different than SNPA. Tastes like a watered down version. Kind of disappointing.

A medium amber body with a white head that had mild retention. Aroma had a really nice malt presence which consisted of toasted malts, but had nice sweet caramel malts. A slight nutty presence. Flavor was a bit of a let down. Toasted myself were nice but mild and the sweetness from the caramel malts did not much effect. Mostly two dimensional. Smooth finish. Nice beer overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle- Pours mostly clear light amber with a one finger head that reduces with some spotty lace. Aroma is caramel malt, peppery, not much else. The taste is caramel malt, very amberish, kind of boring, thin. I think this is the most boring beer to ever come from SN, never thought they would come out with such a bland mass market beer like this.
Moderate caramel and rich malt aroma. Clear amber with minimal white head. Taste is thin caramel and toffee. Semi-crisp dry finish.
Bottle. The look is clear, amber in color, and has a beige colored head. The smell is firm hops, malt, caramel, bread, and dough. The taste is bread, caramel, malt, hops, ok.

Bottle: Thanks, Kevin. Orange, almost copper body, pretty cloudy with a soapy, dingy white cap that fades quickly to a thin film & collar. Sheety lacing. Aroma of lightly toasted bread, a hint of caramel & Vienna malts, some grassiness, & a little bit of DMS. Fresh, clean on the nose. Taste is similar with a strong toasted malt background. A touch of spicy, Noble hop bitterness rings in with some dry bread, yeast, & faint DMS in the finish. Slight aftertaste of milled grains & Vienna malts that linger. Pretty solid for the style, would have been better in the Sierra Nevada SUMMER Pack as opposed to the Fall Pack.

From Fall pack. Clear amber color with an enticing aroma of toasted malt, hay, sweetness, and bread. Tastes like it smells. Light body smooth and very drinkable. A good malt flavor well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle from Downer Wine and Spirits. Pours a deep Amber color with an off white head and a little lacing. Aroma is bread, cereal, a little grassy hops. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, bread, cereal, some pine, some grass, some hay, with a light, clean, bitter finish. Very nice, especially given its not a typical style for SN.

12 oz bottle from a Fall mix pack. Pours a translucent copper color with a large white head that has good retention and ample lacing. The aroma is lightly sweet with sweetened grains and malts. The taste is saccharine sweet with a good bready finish. The palate was thin and watery, and the carbonation soft. Finished short and sweet. Overall: Like the description said a perfect summer session beer--so why is it in the fall mix pack?

Pours a clear orangy amber with a very thick creamy buff head. Malty aroma has nice hoppy and fruity undertones. Crisp flavor is fairly hoppy, subtly fruity, a hint of vanilla, a little bitter, quite refreshing. Mouthfeel is average, but no big deal. Vienna waits for you.

Bottle - label states 5.3% abv - light orange, with a minimal head - nose of fairly rich maltiness, candied fruit, light toasty bread, a touch of floral hops - flavor is simple, but pleasantly balanced - medium sweet toasty maltiness, a mild mineral leads to a drier second half, with some nutty and earthy malt character, and a moderate bitterness to finish - a little too simple, and nothing really pops enough to make me untreated in having any more, but its nice enough to drink.
Sweet and smooth. Not too complicated. Sweet overall with some caramel. No roasted flavors.

12 oz bottle. Amber in color with a decent sized off-white head. Aroma is of toffee, caramel, light bread, toast, light herbal hops, and a hint of marshmallow. Taste is of malt, toast, toffee, faint earthiness, nuts, and dried leaves.

Bottle. A golden pour with one finger of crackling off white head. Nose shows lots of bready toasted malt and a lightly sweet character over notes of herbal hops. Flavor shows lots of toasted grain and bread with a nice spicy hop balance. Medium body and spicy almost dry palate and finish.

Bottle from Fall 12 Pack. Glowing amber pour with a frothy white head. Toasty, baked bread and slightly nutty aroma with light floral aroma. Slightly chewy mouthfeel with toasted bread, nuts with some caramel malt and a mild floral accent at the end. Medium bodied and a clean finish. Super drinkable and a great addition.

12 oz bottle. Pours brilliant amber with long lasting, foamy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of grassy hops and bready malt. Body is medium and smooth. Herbal hops, some caramel and biscuit malt fill the mouth. Finish is long and hoppy. Nice, tasty brew.

12oz bottle. Clear copper with a small white head. Toasty caramel malt aroma, mild honey. Slightly sweet flavor with perfect bitterness at the finish. Caramel and grains. Medium-bodied with average carbonation. Great Wiener Lager!

Poured into a pokal, with a small off-white head and an amber liquid. A toast aroma, the flavors are mild and pleasant. Sierra Nevada has definitely hit a good note with this one. Will be great with pizza.
Bottle pour. Clear golden with off white medium head. Caramel, notes, and bread aroma. Silky medium body. Roasted nuts, bread, with light toffee.

Pours a crisp clear medium dark gold with a 1/2 finger head. Aroma is of a toasty bread with notes of caramel and nuts and a hint of dough. Taste is a light mild roasty with low sweetness on the front and a light and quickly fading bitterness on the back. Leaves a moist mouthfeel which is refreshing on the palate. Overall Id say this is a good lager which would be great for a mild day thats laid back. Its definitely well balanced and delicious.
It has a very appealing bready/malty taste thet is very unique, especially for a Lager.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a clear medium hopper with a half finger off-white head. Just ok head retention and lacing but average for the style.

Aroma is quite fruity with swirls of toffee and caramel. A quick hit of grassy hops followed by some more fruit.

The flavor continues the fruit and grass theme. It is almost a grape/watermelon thing mixed with hay. Sweet caramel follows and provides a nice base. Bitterness is fairly high for the style but it is crisp.

Overall, a great shot at a Vienna from Sierra Nevada. A little hoppier and fruitier than most others in the style but it works well here.

Poured into my Sam Adams glass. Light copper color with a quickly fading tan head. Aroma is breast with caramel notes and floral hops. Flavor matches the aroma exactly. Well balanced flavors with good carbonation and mouthfeel. Nice representation of the style.

bottle-from the Sierra nevada Fall Pack september 2014
Pours bright light amber hue with a nice eggshell white head and sparse lacing. nice looking brew. Nose is mostly lite spicy hops, caramel, toasted grains, bread/biscut notes. Flavors are toasted malt grains (pale, caramel, pils), lite spicy hops and some nice lite woody notes. A very solid offering from this pack. I am not a huge amber lager fan but this fits the bill perfect! crisp, lite and refreshing with alot of lager character. Excellent!

Bottle. Amber. Toast and light caramel with breast malt. Balanced crisp lager mouthfeel. Very clean and drinkable. Some floral hop notes. Damn good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Fall Pack from local Smiths. Nice Pale Ale color, white head, and medium carbonation. Pleasantly surprised at the midrange punch this one provides. Perfect for warm, early fall afternoons. Might be the perfect one step down from SN Pale Ale. Once again, too bad its just a seasonal.

Clear pale amber pour with a 2 finger fluffy beige head. Aroma is toasty and sweet mostly, with some cereal and floral and light lemony citrus hops. Flavor is very much more cereal forward, with some sweet malt, lots of breadiness, pale caramel, and fruity, and floral hops. Light to medium body with a creamy then syrupy feel, medium carbonation. This is pretty good as far as Viennas go.
Light amber pour, grainy aroma. Tastes of toasted malt and grain with light hops and faint bitterness.
bottle into glass, with dark red orangish pour with white head, weird, funky aroma, not sure what to thin of this, just konda hmm
Aroma is caramel, light fruit and malts. The flavor is fruit, caramel, light citrus and a mildly bitter/tart finish. Very easy to drink, among the best in the style.

Bottle, shared by me... in my dining room... just now.
Pours a nice bright orange color with a medium sized head with a little lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is clean & a touch faint. Its got a nice bready character with some toasted malt and floral hop aromas. 

The flavor is nice & is generally centered around a robust malt character that is lightly sweet with a toasty bit and some mild caramel. The hop profile balances this all really very well with a nice herbal character and a well employed low to medium level of bitterness. The beer finishes clean and dry. 

very enjoyable.
Mild aroma. Decent head after poured with a little lacing. Copper color and small bubble carbonation. Hoppy taste and bitter finish. Full mouth feel and smooth.

From bottle. Clear copper with a short head.
Red apple fruitiness in the nose with maybe some metal notes; simple malt, little aroma hops, but clean. Medium-light body, a little syrupy across the middle, growing bitterness late. Nice flavor balance, but its nothing to demand your attention.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass purchased in Denver, CO. I am not super familiar with this style, but loved it non the less

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear amber-rust colored with a foamy off-white head. Aroma of toast, toffee, and earth. Taste is malty with a slight toastiness. Light-medium bodied.

Bottle. Pours an amber color with white head. Bread, malt, toast aromas. Toffee, toast, caramel flavors. A very refreshing amber lager. Plenty of flavor, yet still very drinkable and tasty. Very nice Sierra Nevada.
A pretty orange, this is a light beer that is malty but not too much. A decent beer, be great to introduce "bad beer"drinkers to.
Pours an amber golden color with a white head. Malt, caramel, toffee, bread and toast aroma and flavors. Medium light body and average carbonation. Bread and caramel finish.

Good amber/vienna lagers... really thats something there isnt a whole lot of in the high quality department. Im sure theres some great European ones but that only one I really enjoy is GL Elliot Ness, the rest I find lacking. With this style balance really is key, a playful dance of toast, cereals, grass, caramel and light pine comes through here luckily. Perfect timing realy as this is what one wants when the summer nights get cooler, and nice to have another brewers take on the style that isnt thin or overtly sweet. Lightly sweet, bitter jabs with a malty dry finish.

Clear brilliant copper under a thin foamy white head. The nose is very biscuity and grainy-earthy. The flavor is a tad bit large and bold for its style, which I have no problem with, but the flavor profile itself is a bit too toast and biscuit for my taste, with amber grains and a lager yeasty finish. A bit doughy sweet throughout.

This was poured into a pilsener.
The appearance was a nice golden bronzed slightly amber color with a slight transparency about it. Carbonation was seen rising at a nice pace. A one finger white foamy head appears and dissipates within about a minute.
The smell had a nice roasted nuttiness about it with a smooth caramel and toffee upon it.
The taste was mainly sweet with a rolling nuttiness opening up on my taste buds. Lingering nutty to caramel aftertaste leading into a dry nutty finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a light sessionability about it. The carbonation seems good for the style and for me.
Overall, mmmm....good Vienna Lager Id have again and personally I think this would go great with pepperoni pizza.

Sierra Nevada Vienna Lager has a thick, frothy, cream-colored head, a clear, bubbly, amber appearance, and very little lacing left behind. The aroma is of semi-sweet malts, a touch of hop resin, and mild roastiness. Taste is of mildly roasted malt, brown bread, nutiness, and low-level hop bitterness, which does seem appropriate. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and Sierra Nevada Vienna Lager finishes crisp, refreshing, and very easy going. RJT

Copperish light bronze color. short head. Aroma of some sweet caramel, mineral, light toast., slight orange. Has some Oktoberfest malt character. Smooth with some sweet caramel, some citrus,light grass pine in finish. Not a style I go for, but its fine on occasion. Probably would go better with food.
Bottle from Tacoma boys. Pours a light Amber. Very thin white head. Scent is a little malty. Taste is some caramel. Not my favorite style but, a good beer.

bottle from fall mix pack. clear copper with a small white head. aroma of grassy hops and a hint of toasted malt and pear juice. flavor has notes of pear/apple esters, faint toasted malts for character and a clean grassy hops. lingering bitterness. standard.
amber color; musty, malty aroma; bready malt flavor; fairly well balanced with noble hops

Pours amber with a medium head that retained well and left nice lacing. Aromas of caramel malt and grassy hops. Taste is a perfect balance of malt and hops with the bitterness winning out in the finish. Medium body, lively carbonation, rich chewy mouthfeel and a crisp finish.
light bronze color with a thin off-white head. aroma is caramel and roasted malts. Flavor is toasted malts with some spice and pine.

Bottle pour amber with toasty malt on the nose and a malty, earthy backbone with a nice lasting head. CaraRed malt for color, Vienna and Munich malt for taste and aroma. Overall, a very nice Vienna Lager.

12oz bottle. Bright, hazy, unfiltered orange-tan body. Very thin, but steady off-white head. Pretty true to style. Clean, toasty malt. Medium bodied, very drinkable. Has enough of a noble hop bite and balance to give it an upfront bite and stay interesting. Clean, not cloying or sticky at all. Well made, fresh lager.

12 ounce bottle into lager glass, bottled on 7/18/2014. Pours fairly crystal clear golden orange color with a 1 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of caramel, toast, biscuit, nuttiness, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of bready malt, earthy hop, and yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of caramel, toast, biscuit, nuttiness, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Light earthy/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, toast, biscuit, nuttiness, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice robustness and balance of bready malt, earthy hop, and yeast ester flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Incredibly clean in flavors as well. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice Vienna lager! All around great robustness and balance of bready malt, earthy hop, and yeast ester flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

355ml bottle. Pours a brilliant clear amber, slightly off white head fizzles away quickly with not much lacing. Aroma is sweet toasted grain, some spice, dried fruits, hint of apple. Flavor is caramally and biscuity, light diacetyl note but not over the top. Lower bodied and easy to crush. Lingering sweetness on the palate. Sweeter than an Austrian "Maerzen". Blows a Boston Lager out of the water. 6 pack of this please.

Fresh bottle. Nose is sweetly malty with caramel and very light toasting, pours dull copper, transparent with almost no carbonation and yet a dense, tight sudsy beige head. Taste is sweet with great toasted malts and light bread through to the finish and aftertaste, light bits of bread crusts, and a big thrust of watery lemony citrus right up the middle. Hops very light and earthy/noble.  Body light-medium, watery but with a tumbling malty feel to compensate. I love the heck out of the toast into the aftertaste, lots of great Maillard character; on the whole, typical SN: clean, moreish, very simple and solid.

Deep golden brew with the aroma of caramel and a slight metalic. Flavor is better than most lagers with a slight spicy hop flavor and a bit more body than the big corporate brews (bud, coors, etc). Have to admit I did enjoy these on this hot afternoon.
Bottle. Okay, a bit hoppy, somewhat balanced, somewhat uneven and ragged. Has character though.

Bottle: The aroma is very light and consists of lightly toasted grains with a hint of caramel. It pours a transparent amber with a two finger beige head that has decent retention before fading to a very thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. There is some sporadic webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with light-moderate caramel and light fruit. The finish has light toasted grain/cereal notes with some grassiness. Its light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Is this boston lager repackaged? Been awhile since I had one but it sure is similar. While not a preference of mine it was in the SN fall mixer so it is not gonna be wasted. Solid quality lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12 oz bottle into a dimpled mug. The label has a short description of the beer and it lists the abv at 5.3% abv. 
Appearance: The body has a nice orange amber color with great clarity and some visible carbonation. This is topped off with an average one finger tall head which is off white in color and settles down to a thin layer of foam. Lacing is slick and mostly just slide right down the sides of the glass as I drink. 
Smell: It has a light overall presence. What is noticeable is mostly sweet and malty. It has nice toffee and nougat like notes with just a touch of floral hop spice. 
Taste / Palate: The flavor is well balanced leaning just towards the malty sweet side. Like the aroma it has a very nice malty sweetness with light toffee and nougat like sweetness that is delicately balanced by Noble hop spice. It has a medium body and a smooth easy drinking feel. The drinkability of this beer is crazy good.
Light copper pour, 3 fingers of creamy off white head. Nose is dough, hint of hops. Bitter. Middle is bread and medium roasted grain. Finish is dry. Missing something, but not bad.

Pours a reddish amber-copper with a thin off white head which fades to very little lacing. Aroma is of toasted bready malts, biscuit malts, caramel, sweet malts, and toasted lager malts. Taste is about the same as the aroma. Has a medium-light body with a slightly watery mouthfeel and a mostly sweet, medium finish. Overall, a decent beer that is a little too sweet for my tastes by is really good for a mediocre style.

Packaged on 7/18/14
Pours clear amber with persistent head and lace.
Dry up front with some lingering bitterness.
Part of a seasonal fall multi twelve pack.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a reddish amber with a medium white head. Aroma is mildly floral with caramel and toasted malt. Flavor is crisp, mild floral hops and caramel and toasted malt notes. Light mouthfeel, lively carbonation, crisp, with a mild toasted malt finish. Crisp, clean finish. Pretty nice.
I would say slightly above average for a beer in this class, enjoyable and smooth clash for a good one
Pretty good vienna lager. Smooth and mild. Light breadiness, some fruit and honey.
Pours a clear golden/orange with a big rocky white head. Spice and bread aroma. Sweet caramel malt flavor, along with buttered biscuits and a mild grassiness. Pretty damned good!

12oz bottle, 2014 FallPack mixed 12pk. Pours deep amber/copper color. Thin white ring. Aroma of lightly toasted grains, lagered scent, dominate earthy honey notes. Toasted flavor. Dry finish. Medium bodied. Finishes with a flavor of toasted malts & wooded grains. Very clean. (4155)

Pours clear golden copper with a large white head. The aroma has clean bready malt, light vanilla, light spicy/leafy hops and mild caramel. It has a medium / light rough body with some fairly sharp abrasive carbonation. The flavor starts really dry with crackers, dry caramel, fruitiness (apple / dried apricot sort of thing), spicy hops and herbal notes. The finish has far more of a hoppy presence than most of the style and remains bone dry. This is a beer you could study for subtleties or drink down quick and not thing much about. Enjoyable.
Pours clear copper with a white head. Aroma hay, citrus and other bright fruits. Taste follows nose with bread notes

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2014 Bottle from 2014 Fall Pack into pils glass, clear copper color with cream colored head. Aroma of toasted malt sweetness, grain and faint flroal/grass note. Taste adds some light caramel, bread and peppery hop bitterness. Light body, heavy-moderate carbonation, crisp with mild herbal/earthy bitter finish. Quite enjoyed this.
Clear amber pour with ample off white head. Smell and taste are that of moderately sweet caramel grains, hints of fruits. Certainly prefer this over Yuengling.
Pours a clear copper, with little to no head. Havent had too many Viennas outside of Boston lager, but this one is a nice drinker. Not much hop bite, which is odd for anything SN, but still solid.

Pours a clear light copper with a little bit of lacing off white head. Aroma is light with hints of caramel and whole grain bread. Slight floral hint as well comes thru. Taste is very grainy. Lots of bread flavors with slight floral notes from the hops. Finishes dry. For the style, it's pretty good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle, good beer, solid for the style that is not an exciting one. medium amber colored pour, medium body. caramel males, light fruitiness, bread. decent

4oz pour at the Maxs Taphouse Beer Camp event. Pours a clear orange with some cloudy, white head. Nose has a real distinct grainy character, nutty like peanut skins, plenty of yeasty dough, a bit of buttered toast. Flavor is spot on, yeasty bread, flicks of orange, some biscuit. Clean finish. So true to style.

Tap at the brewery a while back. Im currently rating every SN brew Ive ever had in one clean sweep. 
I grew up on the classic SN Pale having it around during high school, and since have watched SN grow into a national representation of incredible craft beer. Living 45 mins away is a treat for the random growler fill. Keep up the amazing work and thanks!

pours a lovely shade of dark amber, with flecks of red glinting in the background, topped with firm white head. The aroma was grass, mild herbs and some lemon in the mix. Taste was toasty with a firm caramel sweetness all balanced with an unobtrusive hop bite, medium bodied and far too easy to drink (4 mouthfuls did the trick!).

Clean straw gold pour with one finger of crackling off white head. Nose shows lots of bready toasted malt and a lightly sweet character over notes of herbal hops. Flavor shows lots of toasted grain and bread with a nice spicy hop balance. Medium body and spicy almost dry palate and finish.

Served on draft at Beer Run. Pours a clear golden color with a medium creamy offwhite head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of toasted malts and floral hops. The taste is toasted malts, bitter hops with herbal and spicy notes. Medium bodied. Strong carbonation. A bit too hoppy.

Sampled on tap on 7/20/2011 at Beer Revolution. This Vienna pours an orange gold color from the tap. Small to medium sized white foamy head, with good retention and nice lacing. The aroma is fruity and sweet, some caramel and some bread. A medium bodied Vienna. The malts are fruity, bready, and sweet. The hops are herbal and earthy. Mild carbonation. Nice balance. Clean and crisp. Bready, caramel and slightly sweet. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
chiara,poca schiuma poco dolce, allinizio retrogusto leggermente amarognolo ma persistente.beverina!

Pale golden pour with a tight creamy white head.  The nose is fairly lean with a lightly toasted nose.  Bright, fresh maltiness with a distinctly minerally/herbal hoppiness toward the finish.  Really bright, fresh and clean.  Easily quaffable quality.  Easy to drink, well-balanced and quite tasty.  There is a kiss of noble hoppiness on the finish that just comes across as a bit of light spiciness.
tap at Blind Tiger SN event - copper pour, crackery, caramel malts. dry smooth body with a touch of grain and light fruitiness. Lightly hopped but pretty astringent finish.
Part of the sampler tray at the brewery. Tought to judge based on two ounces, but was not a big fan of this one.

Draft @ Sierra Nevada. Pours a bright, clear, effervescent golden-orange color; significant, creamy, fine-bubbled white head with great retention and lacing; beautiful pour with lacing that coats the glass. Softly grainy, Grape-Nuts-like malt presence in the nose: clearly expressed and fresh; light mineral hop character present as well; very engaging and crisp. Medium to medium-light body; lively carbonation; lightly creamy and certainly crisp; the mouthfeel and body on this is great: crisp, dry, lightly bitter; light acidity; again, that fresh Grape Nuts / toasted malt core here is key, beautifully presented; I could drink this endlessly; very sessionable. Medium finish: toasty malt, light sugar, minerals, and even a mild huskiness; nicely dry.

Draught at the brewpub.   The appearance is a little light for what I imagine a Vienna lager to be, but its not like its a style that is well defined over here; more of a light amber-orange with good clarity.   The head is creamy and has good retention.   The aroma has a nice bready malt quality and a light touch of grassy, herbal, piney hops.   The flavor has a dry, toasty, bready malt profile and a snappy, herbal hop bitterness.   Clean toasted grain lasts through the finish.   Much like a pils but with a deeper, toastier malt profile.   Light bodied with a lingering finish of both toasty malt and hop bitterness.   Good, but missing some cohesiveness that could make it great.

Sample at the brewpub. Clear gold/amber pour with a medium off-white head. Nose is sweet malt, later yeast, a bit of caramel and noble hops. Crisp later flavor with some caramelly sweetness. Dries out a bit in the finish.

Tap at BT.  Pours a clear light amber/orange with a small white head.  Aroma is light toasted malts, bready, moderately sweet malts, light caramel and toffee, and fresh herbal hops. Flavor is nicely toasted malts, but a bit thinning and not too big, light mineral and clean hop bitterness in the end.  Pretty nice.

Tap at Blind Tiger: Light copper golden with a fading head. Doughy Munich malt aroma with a touch of sweetness- clean. The body is nice and creamy with a clean and spicy Munich malt presence. Clean, softly sweet and has a balancing spicy German hop finish. A very solid session that feels authentically German.
On tap at Pizza Port San Clementes Session Ale fest 2009, its a clear golden color, which is surprising for a vienna. Not much going on in the flavor.

On tap at the Session Ale Fest at Pizza Port Carlsbad. Pours a light hue for a Vienna, with a off-white head. Aroma is biscuity and malty with a bit of vegital. Taste is grainy and bready with some grassy hops. Nothing special. Medium fizz.
On tap at PP Carlsbad.  Clear yellow pour, frothy white head.  Sweet malt, biscuits, hint of vegatble, and light hops.  Non-offensive, but not to interesting.

Yellow orange in color... Aroma is crisp, subtle malts...Flavor is nice and crisp, reminds me of Germany... Not a huge fan of lagers, but it does a nice job accentuating the caramel flavor, and has a nice dry finish... Not bad

Tap at Blind Tiger. Dry, floral aroma. Kind of sweaty and rich. Nice head. Dry, crisp, refreshing. Cookie and lettuce/cucumber notes. Bready malts and light euro hops. Very very nice. Super sessionable.

Draught at 2006 Craft Lager Festival.  Pours gold with a foamy white head and spotty lacing.  Aroma is corn, potatoes, malt (grain, meal), yeast (sweat).  Sour, bitter and tart hoppy yeast flavor, grainy malt finish.  Light bodied and dry, fizzy palate.
Draft. Amber beer with a low whitish head. Low spicey aroma. Light caramel and spicey flavor. Medium bodied. Lingering spice.

I had this on tap this past weekend at the Sierra Nevada Tap Room. The bartender informed me that this new brew has only been out for about a week at this time. Normally I prefere ales, but Im always willing to try new brews, and occasionally I do like a lager or pilsner. Anyway, as lagers go this one was pretty good.
Aroma was almost non-detectable; very slight malt.  Poured nice dark golden color with a slight head which dissipated fairly quickly but left a nice lacing all the way through the pint. Carbonation was good  and nice medium body. The foretaste slightly toasted malt with a nice bitter finish, much as youd expect from an ale. As lagers go, this is among the better offerings out there and definitely worth the price of 2.25 a pint.
